website_summaries.verdict: The type of RV trailer cover to choose if you need something for your R-Pod-style, medium-size trailer.
pros: Specifically designed for the aerodynamic curves of R-Pod-trailers
Fits trailers up to 20 feet long
Adjustment panels make it easy to get a better, custom-like fit around the trailer
Includes storage bag and tie-down straps
cons: Will not work with normal RV trailers

customer_reviews.title: Fits my Vintage 13 foot camper nicely.
customer_reviews.text: I have a 1958 Franklin Travel Trailer that is 13 feet long. I originally bought the 16ft cover and it didn't work because my camper is shaped differently from the R-Pod. I then tried the 20ft cover and it works perfectly (see pics). Great protection and I love that I can still open the door and get in without having to uncover anything. If you have a canned ham or toaster (classic camper shapes) make sure you buy this cover a few feet longer than you need it. Cheers!
customer_reviews.author: Dave K

customer_reviews.title: A+ quality and warranty service
customer_reviews.text: I purchased from Amazon and used this cover for 2-1/2 years of outdoor storage in the harsh UV and weather of Central Oregon high desert. It was very high quality and performed well, but a small tear appear (possibly from ice load or high wind). I took a few pictures and filled out the on-line warranty form. In less than a week, a brand new cover arrived at my door. No hassle, "service" or shipping fees and quick response. These folks really stand by their 3 year warranty. I would highly recommend the company and products to anyone.
customer_reviews.author: Raoul Picante

customer_reviews.title: Fits 2015 T@B Teardrop trailer
customer_reviews.text: After reading the reviews we ordered this for our 2015 T@B Teardrop. Very happy with it for a fraction of the cost compared to the cost of a true teardrop cover. This covers the entire trailer, encluding the front box. Exactly what we were looking for and very affordable!
customer_reviews.author: Adrianne Smith

customer_reviews.title: A great cover for your camper
customer_reviews.text: Cover is great and fits our RPOD 179 just fine. It is not easy to install, mostly because of the RPOD (tall, and you need a ladder)... Not their fault! We live in the Jacksonville Florida area with lots of Live Oak trees with their debris - it is great to help keep the RPOD clean. Highly recommend. Just don't try to put back in the supplied storage bag. Material is light weight - doubt it will last more than a couple years. HOWEVER, the material is perfect and breathes for the camper... SO - I don't mind, and will buy a new one when needed.
customer_reviews.author: Harry Lisle

customer_reviews.title: DO NOT BUY! This will rot within no time ...
customer_reviews.text: DO NOT BUY! This will rot within no time because it's made from cheap material! I put it on my R-Pod last July and by Sept it was full of holes. Every corner had a hole and the corners are not sharp. Where the door handle sticks out a bit, the cover had a hole. Whatever protrusion it rested on, resulted in a hole. Again, this happened after only 2 months! It's 8mos later now and the holes are huge due to wind. The material is inferior. and they must know it because I have read reviews with the same complaint as mine. Spend a little more money and get one that will last.
customer_reviews.author: Patti

customer_reviews.title: Fits well, good service
customer_reviews.text: This generic cover fits our T@B400 2021 very well, for less than half the price of a custom cover. door lines up and covers thoroughly front to back. Instructions for how to put it on the trailer were almost the opposite of what works, so clearly depends on your trailer. When we attached the under-trailer clips, one of them broke the first time. Ugh, we thought, here we go... But, sent a picture to the company, and they replaced it quickly AND for FREE. So we are happy. See how the winter goes
customer_reviews.author: Foodmaven

customer_reviews.title: Not so good
customer_reviews.text: Coming up on two years. Gray fabric has thinned and tears easily. I've got duct tape patches all over. Leaves a fine coating of dust-like fabric particles all over the trailer body...washes off, but still...Knowing what I know now, I would not have purchased this product.
customer_reviews.author: Gary C. Stone

customer_reviews.title: Started great and went bad FAST
customer_reviews.text: I purchased the deluxe RPOD cover for my camper. I followed the care instruction and was able to use it for only 2 months. My RV is kept in a shaded area. After 2 months the white roof cover started to peel flacked off exposing my roof. I am in contact with the seller , as they have a 3 warranty replace on it. Note you need to have proof of purchase and product code of the item. ITs was to soon to have to do this. Not happy with this at all
customer_reviews.author: Eji3511

customer_reviews.title: fits well, looks nice, effective, easy
customer_reviews.text: fits nicely over my vintage canned ham trailer. we were worried that the little chimney-thing on the roof might prevent it from fitting well, but there's some extra room built into it, so it fits fine. I really like that you can easily unzip the area over the door and go in and out while it's still covered. I also like the colors-- the gray and white is close in color to the silver of my trailer, so it isn't an eyesore in the driveway. Putting it on is a two person job and best done on a non-windy day!
customer_reviews.author: Laura

customer_reviews.title: One season only.
customer_reviews.text: Fits my T@B and I did not have to spend 3x's more for it. Now an update after 3 months use. Has holes in it at various places. Now using duck tape to keep it from further ripping. Cannot understand why it is getting holes in areas that are not subject to abuse. Only good for maybe a year. Looking elsewhere to find a replacement that will last.
customer_reviews.author: sswar

customer_reviews.title: Fit my 1957 Shasta, and happy with purchase
customer_reviews.text: Overall the quality is what I expected. Same as many entry level, yet quality, car covers I have used in the past, but for a travel trailer. Fit was perfect for my 1957 13' (body only) Shasta. Zippers are just about perfect for my door. I'd expect this cover to last about 3 years in normal southern california conditions. Very happy with purchase, wish I would have gotten a cover sooner. Price about $90 is amazing. Considering purchasing another before this one is end of life.
customer_reviews.author: Dennis

customer_reviews.title: BUYER BEWARE - ONE SEASON ONLY
customer_reviews.text: Absolutely shredded in 10 months. Well cared for, just stayed on the trailer through a relatively light winter. I hope warranty covers it, but I really don't see the point because I don't think it was defective, just poor quality. UPDATE: Oh, this is bad. They agreed to cover it under warranty, but left this note: "Please Note: The product warranty does not start over when you receive replacement product. The warranty period is still based on original purchase date." So basically, the lifespan of this product is only as long as the warranty (1 year? 3 years?).
customer_reviews.author: Ben

customer_reviews.title: You get what you pay for--wouldn't purchase again.
customer_reviews.text: We purchased this for our T@B. It fit awkwardly but acceptably for the price. Unfortunately, the cover started getting splits and holes from sun rot before it was a year old. We live in NC, so we get sun, but it's not that intense. By the end of its 2nd summer, the front of the cover was so shredded it was almost unusable (duct tape didn't help as the adjacent fabric just shredded.) Now, after 20 months we have given up and are throwing it away. If you purchase, plan on using it for only one year. We would not purchase again.
customer_reviews.author: Margaret C. Bessette

customer_reviews.title: Good Cover for R-Pod
customer_reviews.text: We bought it for our R-Pos 179. It took two of us and a ladder to get it on, but only around 15 minutes. So far it is working great. We have had high winds and rain. I like the zippered door so I can put stuff I have bought for the next season in the R-Pos. It doesn’t let the door open all of the way, but enough to slip things in.
customer_reviews.author: Tonya Young

customer_reviews.title: Great company - solid product, but not for southern sun.
customer_reviews.text: Had this cover on my r-pod outdoors, semi shade storage area next to my home. The cover looks and performed great for 8-months. We live in southern Alabama in a sub-tropic area, the elements (sun?) eventually made the white fabric top brittle and it tore very easy when taking it off and putting it on. I contacted the COMPANY while still under warranty, THEY WERE GREAT - I had a new within a week. Sadly, the new one has done the same. Lesson learned, I'll find another heavier gauge cover.
customer_reviews.author: Patrick Showalter

customer_reviews.title: Big for my Teardrop but still functional
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this for my Teardrop Camper which is 7'x15' (tongue to tail) and it's a bit too big. However, with the elastic ends and throw bag for the straps underneath it still works. I gave it only 4 stars because the material is thin, has already rub marks from normal wear (looks like an old sweater that has pilled on the arms) and won't do much for storage outside if it snows or hails. If you're just trying to cover it up, it's fine. If you need something for protection; look elsewhere.
customer_reviews.author: Christen Mc

customer_reviews.title: Not an ALL WEATHER cover - doesn’t like the sun
customer_reviews.text: I had this on my T@b 400 for 4 months in Florida... not the summer months. Feb - May and when I went to my storage the roof top portion of the cover had disintegrated to dust! Evidently this is not suitable for Springtime Sun in Florida - very disappointing and hope to get a refund from the 3 year warranty.
customer_reviews.author: Sakina Zerdani

customer_reviews.title: Works great on a Winnebago Minnie Drop 1780
customer_reviews.text: I have a 2018 Winnie Drop 1780 and this cover fits perfectly. The cut outs match the door and lockers and it's good tight fit. After sitting outside for almost two years, I am starting to see some wear and one of the strap attachment points has torn but it's still the best cover I could find. Wish it held up a bit better in the Colorado sun and wind.
customer_reviews.author: Wolfgang Stiller

customer_reviews.title: Fits our T@b 400
customer_reviews.text: This fits our 2019 T@b 400. Its a little loose at front, but goes over our front hitch nicely. and stays put. The under straps have held it on nicely in wind. Very happy we got this and not the more expensive one suggested by the dealer. We have had it for a month now. Hopefully will continue to work well. Keeps pollen and sap off of our trailer.
customer_reviews.author: Janet G

customer_reviews.title: The right cover for the R-Pod
customer_reviews.text: This is the second time I purchased this Rpod cover. The first cover lasted a little under three year. It comes with a three year warranty but I was happy with this cover. I purchased my second cover and I had a problem with it after a year and a half. I contacted Classic accessories with the problem and they replaced the cover right away. I really think for the price this is a very nice cover.
customer_reviews.author: john

customer_reviews.title: R-pod 176T
customer_reviews.text: fits great on our Rpod. this is the first winter with it so I only gave 4 stars since it just was put on. yes we did put it on inside out first, only because I didn't listen to my wife. She's always right. She also stands behind me when I type my amazon reviews
customer_reviews.author: Paul Bessette

customer_reviews.title: Model 3 Fits a 1963 Mobile Scout16' Very Well
customer_reviews.text: Was pleasantly surprised at how well it goes over the old canned ham. I was able to spread it without help, using a step ladder, in 10 minutes or so. The fit is very good, looks good. Giving it 5 stars for now, hoping it holds up to Alabama sun and rain.
customer_reviews.author: lh

customer_reviews.title: Very nice fit
customer_reviews.text: Looks great and fits well. The fit is a little odd at the Thule awning, but not bad. The zippers and attachments are all exactly where they need to be. The fabric seems sturdy and breathable. I will be anxious to see how it held up over a Pennsylvania winter.
customer_reviews.author: Mark seven tenn

customer_reviews.title: Do not buy!
customer_reviews.text: Maybe I should be impressed that a cover made of paper made it almost two months. I try not to judge, but I think I have to call shenanigans on this one. It just plain disintegrated. If you are looking for a disposable cover for maybe a long weekend or something, this item may suffice. Otherwise, keep looking.
customer_reviews.author: Laurel

customer_reviews.title: Fits R-Pod 190
customer_reviews.text: Nice cover, fits our R-Pod 190 with awning, A/C and antenna. It did tear a small hole on a sharp corner, but didn't rip open - a piece of duct tape covered it. I taped cardboard to the camper corners to keep from getting more holes. It seems sturdy enough, we'll see what it looks like after a Minnesota winter
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Like any cover, challenging to put on and very lightweight.
customer_reviews.text: I read that this one is lightweight which it is. Only time will tell how it holds up. Really difficult to pit on. Definitly a 2 person job and watch how to videos. Mine still sitting inside trailer after 2 unsuccessful tries on my own. Keep in mind this would happen with any cover. If I had to do again I would spend more money on heavier cover.
customer_reviews.author: DL

customer_reviews.title: Perfect fit for RPOD 179
customer_reviews.text: It made it through the winds in Missouri this year...Small problem with the slideout corners poking just under where the harder material on the top comes to a seam with the less stong bottom plastic...Had to invent corners for both the slide out side, and the front door side...Otherwise they probably would have poked through...
customer_reviews.author: Frew

customer_reviews.title: Cheap!
customer_reviews.text: I actually keep purchasing this product with the expectation that i will replace every two years. I have a 2013 RPOD and i have purchased 4 of these so far. It gets eaten up by the sun and wind after about 2 years. It's like a paper towel after that, so we toss it and get another one. We camp about 5 times per year, and after about 10 on and offs it is shredded. I will keep buying it though at a price point of $115. overall a good product if you dont expect it to last more than 2 years.
customer_reviews.author: Manny Higgins

customer_reviews.title: Perfect fit
customer_reviews.text: Fit just perfect for my T@DA trailer. They don't import this trailer any more and I thought I was going to have trouble replacing the cover, but this is perfect.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Terrible trailer cover
customer_reviews.text: This was really poorly made it didn’t even last through the year. The top all tore up. My finish is ruined all my trailer. Obviously it’s not waterproof or tear proof. You can see in the pictures the finish on my trailer and the torn up cover. Don’t waste your time. Don’t buy this product.
customer_reviews.author: Barbara Jaquez

customer_reviews.title: Not a dependable RV cover
customer_reviews.text: I received this cover for my Forest River R-pod on March 8, 2018. Three days ago, on August 20, 2018, I planned on preparing the trailer to go camping. Upon inspection, the cover had torn in 2 places on the top seam of the cover, where the gray fabric meets the light fabric. The cover was not the most expensive, but I must admit, in 5 months, it does not meet my expectations. I would not purchase this product again. If you are looking for a good, solid, strong RV cover, please look elsewhere. There should be a warranty, at least for a year.
customer_reviews.author: Barrett

customer_reviews.title: Holds up to wind
customer_reviews.text: Normally I don't write reviews if there are already 200+ reviews but I did want to say I was impressed that this cover held up to 60 mph wind gusts that tore my hot tub cover apart. There are not even any tears on this cover. Good job.
customer_reviews.author: muckamuck

customer_reviews.title: Definitely worth it
customer_reviews.text: Fit our T@B 320-S perfectly. Easy to put on. Enough room to cover boxes and tub on the tongue. Dont know about waterproof/durability yet, but for just over $100 it could be easily replaced if needed. 3 yr warranty
customer_reviews.author: CP

customer_reviews.title: It Tore Apart
customer_reviews.text: Bought it, installed it, it began to rip apart in a year. The material tore in several places. We get some hot days and rarely any windy days. So I do not recommend this cover for outdoors.
customer_reviews.author: JAVELIN

customer_reviews.title: Nice light-weight cover
customer_reviews.text: This is a very nice cover, but please know it is made of lightweight material. If you snag it on something when putting on the cover, it will rip. We've had it on our R-Pod 178 for two months now, and I've entered the RV through the door panel several times with no issues.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: 3 year warranty
customer_reviews.text: The cover fit my rpod 183g like a glove. Like the ability to get in and out of my trailer with the cover on
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Poor durability
customer_reviews.text: Coming up on one year and this cover simply disintegrated! Not wind torn but simple exposure to our harsh sun and high temperatures caused it break down. It started turning into a fine powder and disintegrated when you touched it. Surprising this did not happen to the white roof, which appears to be made of a different type of product. Maybe their more expensive cover would do better, but this cover was a total waste of money.
customer_reviews.author: John Doe

customer_reviews.title: So far so good, I have had this on my trailer for ...
customer_reviews.text: So far so good, I have had this on my trailer for two weeks and no problems. I hope the durability on this last at least 3 years but since I have had it for such a short time I cannot judge the durability of the item but I do like the feel of it at this point.
customer_reviews.author: Tom C

customer_reviews.title: It fits a Casita perfect
customer_reviews.text: I have a casita 17ft Delux. I oredered this cover in hopes it would fit. As you can see in the photo it is perfect. I am very pleased . I recommend this cover to anyone with a casita RV . It is a very reasonable price .
customer_reviews.author: Faye

customer_reviews.title: We are happy with this cover
customer_reviews.text: We bought this for a smaller T@B teardrop trailer, so it fits loose and hangs on the ground if we don't tie it up. It covers the whole trailer including the hitch area and the tires. The door opening lines up with the door and it protects the trailer from sun damage. We are happy with this cover.
customer_reviews.author: Paul Martzen

customer_reviews.title: Excellent Customer Service
customer_reviews.text: Our cover takes a beating in all day sun. And yes, after several years it needed to be replaced, but the company is great to work with and made a durable product considering the demand we put on it.
customer_reviews.author: K. Warner

customer_reviews.title: Classic Covers service personnel were great. They shipped me out a new one the ...
customer_reviews.text: Cover fell apart and ripped into pieces after only one use. Classic Covers service personnel were great. They shipped me out a new one the next day. Cover seemed to be almost rotten after first use. Product was bad, but Classic Service was great
customer_reviews.author: Frank Gibbs

customer_reviews.title: It is a perfect size, but you gotta take the wings off ...
customer_reviews.text: I bought this a year ago for a vintage 1959 Shasta Airflight Canned Ham camper, 15 feet, freshly painted this year so we needed a cover for the Ohio Winter. It is a perfect size, but you gotta take the wings off the camper. I have read reviews that this thing shreds after a year and if that happens I will update this review, it is hard to find covers for vintage things these days so I hope this works out.
customer_reviews.author: Mike C.

customer_reviews.title: Keeps Trailer Clean in Winter
customer_reviews.text: I use this to keep weather off of trailer in the winter. You have to cover all sharp edges because if it gets windy it will tear. It's easy to install and remove if you have help. Not so much if you don't.
customer_reviews.author: Nancy W

customer_reviews.title: Best cover yet for my 1958 shasta canned ham
customer_reviews.text: This is my second cover & by far a better fit for my Shasta than the last one which was too baggy & looked sloppy, this is a great fit & easier to put on. My trailer is a 15' & this cover is a great fit.
customer_reviews.author: J. D. TALL

customer_reviews.title: Holes worn through in first season of use.
customer_reviews.text: Using this cover for the first season and already the corners are wearing through in places, creating holes in the cover. Seems like this is more of a sun shade cover, rather than something designed to keep the elements away from the trailer.
customer_reviews.author: Jeffrey

customer_reviews.title: Don’t buy it rotted out after 4 months in CA winter.
customer_reviews.text: This cover is a piece of garbage. If I could leave zero stars I would. We live in the Central Valley of CA where the temperatures get in the hundreds during the summer. Well this cover didn’t even last the winter and was never exposed to the hot sun of summer. It rotted out after about 4 months on the trailer; and our trailer is stored where it is protected from the sun most of the day. Don’t waste your money!!
customer_reviews.author: J.Herron

customer_reviews.title: Not durable, poor material quality
customer_reviews.text: Original purchased cover lasted about one year and started tearing on the top and corners. Complained to manufacturer and received the one time replacement cover. That cover lasted six months and just like the original, started tearing on top and corners. Both white and grey material tore. The white top material was the worst. It dry rotted and would tear like thin paper. COMPLETE JUNK DO NOT BUY.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Nice Cover for the Money
customer_reviews.text: A nice cover for the price. I use it for a 13' fiberglass camper and it is a bit baggy, but it covers even the tongue. Has vents near the top to minimize condensation and the tow straps hold it on firmly in windy conditions. Remove it before moving your trailer even a little as it is all too easy to get a strap or part of the canvas under a wheel and it will tear the cover.
customer_reviews.author: T. Griebe

customer_reviews.title: R-Pod 179 - fits, but no door access.
customer_reviews.text: Fits perfectly for the R-Pod 179. However, the zipper door opening does not correspond to where the actual door is. Contacting the manufacturer of the cover, they said they don't plan to make a change anytime soon (Fall-2014). But then again, it is a winter cover, so how often does one need to get inside? I disconnected the roof top antenna and laid it flat with a box over it so it would not wear against the cover. Hope this helps potential R-Pod 179 owners.
customer_reviews.author: John R. Benham

customer_reviews.title: Think it will easy last another year
customer_reviews.text: Have use it for two winters now. Starting to show its age only where there are sharp points on the RV I didn't cover over with a pad. Think it will easy last another year. Then we will see next season. Two years so far and looks like at least one or two more years.
customer_reviews.author: Bernard Woodard

customer_reviews.title: Here some actual measurements for other trailers
customer_reviews.text: 20' size is PERFECT for 1999 Thor Cub F16... which (actual box) is 13.5' long on the bottom, 9' long on the top (rounded) and 7' wide throughout. Initially I bought the 16'6" size and it was way too small. I guess the R-Pod is VERY rounded off so the larger sizes take up way less material to cover. Father-in-law bought a cover made up of this same material and it lasted 3 years up against California central valley sun. I'll take that for $150!
customer_reviews.author: thekyle64

customer_reviews.title: Cheap material. Don’t buy.
customer_reviews.text: This piece of junk tore almost immediately after the installation on NBC our TT. The material is cheap and completely useless. Please don’t buy this. Save your money and buy a quality cover.
customer_reviews.author: Jason

customer_reviews.title: Good value  Fits 2011 Heartland MPG 181 perfectly
customer_reviews.text: Fits 2011 Heartland MPG 181 perfectly. Bought for sun protection. The door panel must have been enlarged from previous models. They responded to reviews. Not water proof, it breathes. My roof mounted solar panel works with this on. I can extend the slide out with this on. AC, bath vent and antenna on roof no problem. I expect this to last a few years, then I will reorder. Good value.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: This Trailer Cover Doesn’t last long.
customer_reviews.text: This Trailer Cover didn’t last long on my trailer. The top of the trailer cover is disintegrating and tearing from the sun and I’ve only had this covering my trailer for 5 months. I would not recommend this product.
customer_reviews.author: Ken

customer_reviews.title: Good value for the price
customer_reviews.text: Fit my 2016 RPod 179 perfectly. Love the zippered door opening so I can still access the door without pulling the whole cover off. That said, its not very heavy duty and I ripped it in 2 places when it snagged on the rain gutters. It does tear easily so I am not sure how long it will last, but for a custom fit cover for less than $150, you kinda get what you pay for.
customer_reviews.author: James Baron

customer_reviews.title: Wasted money!
customer_reviews.text: Within 4 weeks and two wind storms of putting this on our trailer, it's shredded. Complete waste of money (and a lot of it to boot). I'm pretty burned up that something that cost so much ended up being such a piece of junk.
customer_reviews.author: A Customer

customer_reviews.title: Very dissatisfied
customer_reviews.text: We bought the cover for our R-pod and it fits perfectly. However, it is totally broken after 5 months of usage. The white top fabric started to tier up at month 2 (we go it in September and use it in San Diego that has a mild weather) and broke completely the last time we removed it a couple of weeks ago. I contacted customer service. Hopefully we will get a replacement.
customer_reviews.author: Elena

customer_reviews.title: Great Fit!
customer_reviews.text: This fit my Little Guy Max perfectly. Love it! So far, so good! Definitely need two people to put on.
customer_reviews.author: DTL

customer_reviews.title: So far, so good!
customer_reviews.text: The product arrived quickly and we put it on camper. It was easy for my wife and I to install with just a 5 ft step ladder to help get the cover over the top of the camper. Looks durable, will know more after it sits out in the snow all winter here in Northern Michigan. But so far, it looks like it should last quite a while.
customer_reviews.author: Eelman

customer_reviews.title: Only useful as a dust cover inside a garage
customer_reviews.text: While the top section seems sturdy, the sides are about as resilient as toilet paper. After a week on the camper just the slight Autumn breeze frayed holes in several places. There is no way this would last outdoors. Consider this a dust cover for a garage queen.
customer_reviews.author: Jan

customer_reviews.title: Great pod cover
customer_reviews.text: Great pod cover. I was afraid it wouldn't fit over the tv antenna & a/c unit but there's plenty of room. Super easy to put on for 2 people, a ladder & a broomstick. Glad I bought this!
customer_reviews.author: Buttchops

customer_reviews.title: Cover for my t@b
customer_reviews.text: I wanted this for my t@b cuz i didnt want to spend as much as t@b cover costs. This is a bit big but not too big. It works great and i am pleased. The door opening isnt quite in the right place but it still works ok. Quality good.
customer_reviews.author: carol

customer_reviews.title: Heck of a good deal since Forest River wants $400 and RV dealerships ...
customer_reviews.text: Heck of a good deal since Forest River wants $400 and RV dealerships get $500 plus for the EXACT same cover. These are made to fit the RPOD perfectly.Breathable and the zippered door and extra roof layer of material are a bonus.The 178 takes this one(the largest). Covers for trailers are indicated by OVERALL length,Hence the 178 is 20' long and takes the 20' cover although the trailer body is only 17' long.....go figure
customer_reviews.author: Steve O'

customer_reviews.title: Nice Cover
customer_reviews.text: I use this for my Tab 400 camper. It fits well and is light weight. It doesn't seem extremely durable but it's not flimsy either. You get what you pay for. There are zippered door sections on both sides.
customer_reviews.author: Kathy

customer_reviews.title: True description??
customer_reviews.text: I ordered this for my Shasta 1961 16 ft camper. The cover came for a 13 ft. and does not fit. Very disappointing. if something is 198 inches long that makes it 16.6 ft long not 13. I had to add one star even tho it didn't deserve it.
customer_reviews.author: Douglas Roberts

customer_reviews.title: So Far, So Good
customer_reviews.text: I can't attest to the durability just yet since this is the first season of use. I would have liked to see a video link of a person installing it. That would have been helpful. So far, so good.
customer_reviews.author: D. J. Obaza

customer_reviews.title: Well made and durable.
customer_reviews.text: It fits pretty tight on my retro 130, but these are designed for the r-pods. None the less it seems to be durable and will protect my camper. The real test will be how it does over this New England winter.
customer_reviews.author: Darren S

customer_reviews.title: Quality cover for R-pod
customer_reviews.text: Not an easy one-person cover to put on (not sure for the R-pod there is any cover that would be easy for one person), but fits really well and quality seems great. We'll see how well it lasts. Comes with straps to tie it down securely to trailer.
customer_reviews.author: Chris Lenaghen

customer_reviews.title: Good item
customer_reviews.text: You can replace these things every year so it’s windy and outside where I’m at though
customer_reviews.author: Home hunter

customer_reviews.title: I own a 2015 RPod and it fits perfect. Best to start from front to back using ...
customer_reviews.text: Received this cover in the mail today went right on with no tears or rips! I own a 2015 RPod and it fits perfect. Best to start from front to back using the yellow tag in the front as a guide and the zippered door also as a guide. We used 2 ladders on each side and my daughter stayed in the front to guide us keeping the yellow tag centered in the front of the camper. Takes 3 people to get it on but is fairly easy to do. Fabric is not too thin as described by other reviewers and the support straps snap on perfectly. I think it will work out great and the price is amazing.
customer_reviews.author: Sherry Tate

customer_reviews.title: Top of Cover Completely Shredded within 4 months
customer_reviews.text: While this cover came almost immediately after ordering, and fit our Winnie Drop perfectly, the top (all of the white colored material) completely shredded within 4 months. We took the cover (what was left of it) off, and the white fabric tore as easily as paper towels. We live in the Portland, Oregon area, so our weather is not extreme. Completely useless. Do not purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Karla K

customer_reviews.title: Ripped in Less Than a Year
customer_reviews.text: The cover fit well but in less than a year, it had several rips. The material seems flimsy. I filled out a complaint with the company including all documentation and photos and never heard back. The only place I can see this being helpful is if it was in a covered area and you just wanted to keep it clean.
customer_reviews.author: Marisa Marinac

customer_reviews.title: No protection.
customer_reviews.text: Not sure what this cover is supposed to protect from, I left mine covered all winter and found it had allowed water to leak through. $2500 in damage by spring.
customer_reviews.author: Jawn

customer_reviews.title: So far so good
customer_reviews.text: Fits great, hopefully it lasts, I’ll come back and redo my review if it falls apart in a year
customer_reviews.author: Bennett889

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for an RPod
customer_reviews.text: The cover fits perfectly and looks great on the RPod. This is our second Classic Accessories cover. The previous one lasted three years in areas where we receive very high winds. Would have been five stars if it had been reinforced in the areas where they knew it would rub against sharp edges making the cover last longer.
customer_reviews.author: mdcrosses

customer_reviews.title: you get what you pay for
customer_reviews.text: well as it said on the package it was for a 20 ft camper and mine is 20 ft from back to the tongue of the trailer so it shoulda fit but it didnt and when I went to put on it ripped right up the face of the cover and now is trash it is not very durable at all but I guess you get what you pay for would not buy again even if it was given to me
customer_reviews.author: andrew shoaff

customer_reviews.title: Easy to use.
customer_reviews.text: Its great to wrap up my camper and help protect from ice and snow.
customer_reviews.author: Cheryl Reich

customer_reviews.title: worthless camper cover
customer_reviews.text: This product is a piece of junk. Really inferior! I bought it on May 4 2016, and just threw it away on December 5 2016. I tried to cover my camper with it and my hand went right through the material. It's only 7 months old, and has been in the direct sun here in Florida. It is literally falling apart. Don't waste your money on this cover...
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Thank you
customer_reviews.text: Only used cover for a few months, and am happy with it
customer_reviews.author: Tom

customer_reviews.title: Ignore the negative comments.
customer_reviews.text: Extremely pleased with this cover for our Rpod. Easy to put on. We started at the front with a ladder on each side. I don't understand the complaints about rips. If you follow the written instructions, you should have no problems. This inexpensive cover is well worth having no cover and having to wash it all the time to keep the dirt off.
customer_reviews.author: Susan P.

customer_reviews.title: Top disintegrated after about 10 weeks. Very Disappointing.
customer_reviews.text: Very disappointed in this product. Bought it and it stayed on its box, inside my home (in the a/c). Finally parked my trailer and covered it. It was great! Except that it only lasted about 10 weeks when the top started disintegrating ... I couldn’t believe it. I took it off and the top was like dust. Very disappointing.
customer_reviews.author: Deborah Turner

customer_reviews.title: Torn apart in 6 months in storage
customer_reviews.text: We were seriously disappointed with this product. We placed a brand new cover on our camper in November for outside winter storage. Came back to uncover the camper in May and the entire top of the cover was torn to shreds. I checked back on the order to see if there was any warranty on the product and sad to see that there wasn't one. Will not buy again.
customer_reviews.author: chad crabtree

customer_reviews.title: Watch the style of your camper-does not fit box style.
customer_reviews.text: Not a bad product, but note that this does NOT fit up to 16', 6" UNLESS the top is rounded as in the teardrop style. I have a 14' box style camper and it was WAY too small. Unfortunately, I am disabled and was unable to hire someone to fold it back into the box until today, and now I have missed my return window. I guess there is no recourse since it was sold by Amazon.
customer_reviews.author: Cockatiels R Us

customer_reviews.title: Great Product!
customer_reviews.text: We don't have an R-Pod but a similar style 13ft trailer. This cover does an excellent job keeping it dry from the rain, safe from sun exposure etc. Because our model is not an R-Pod there is some slack but we anticipated that & it isn't a problem. This product is well designed and holds up well. I appreciate the color and design as it blends in and looks nice.
customer_reviews.author: Fire Dancer

customer_reviews.title: Just adequate
customer_reviews.text: Fits the Nucamp tab Outback edition.Special order covers are over $500 seriously? This one is way less expense and has a 3 yr warranty. Not water proof. Water quits beating up after a few uses.Protects the sun from beating down on it. Nothing is like a enclosed garage.
customer_reviews.author: Effortless shopping

customer_reviews.title: does fit as described, material won't last to long ...
customer_reviews.text: does fit as described, material won't last to long and out of package had about 4 -5 inch cut/tear up front door side. was cheap enough I will fix it myself less hassle than return
customer_reviews.author: Rick D.

customer_reviews.title: So far so good
customer_reviews.text: Fits our new 2018 Jayco HUMMINGBIRD 17RB travel trailer great. I am a bit concerned about how it will hold up over time after reading some of the other reviews here, but so far it seems good.
customer_reviews.author: Rob_B

customer_reviews.title: Terrible durability, quality.  Easily torn in the wind.
customer_reviews.text: The cover tore within a month. The zipper broke about the same time. It is easy to put it in my camper with one person. I have had it about 18 months and it's basically like covering the camper with a paper towel; it only barely keeps water off and only in certain places.
customer_reviews.author: Jay Sims

customer_reviews.title: to cover a T@G XL Outback
customer_reviews.text: We bought this to cover our T@G XL Max Outback. It's too big, but we like that we can cover the tires with it by wrapping it down and around. We shall see how it does with the Michigan winters. We really liked the price compared to all of the other options.
customer_reviews.author: Molly

customer_reviews.title: Good to great fit
customer_reviews.text: Good to great fit. Definitely takes two people and a ladder to cover the unit. Only issue is that there are only a couple of points where it can be cinched tight thereby allowing other points to flap, which caused a rip the first winter we used it.
customer_reviews.author: sfs

customer_reviews.title: Fits tight, covers everything.
customer_reviews.text: Make sure you pull this cover out before trying to put it on your R-pod. You will need to fold it differently than the way they packed it. It’s well marked which is the front and back. I used a broom to position it on the top of the trailer, then pulled it over the sides. It’s a tight fit which is great.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Caution! Did not last 60 days. Disintegrated in less than 2 months.
customer_reviews.text: Purchased on May 25, removed today due to disintegration on material. extremely disappointed. Don't waste your money you would be better off using a tarp! Complete junk. I am not surprise it will not let me upload photos.
customer_reviews.author: David Kalish

customer_reviews.title: is that the fabric is very thin and can easily be torn
customer_reviews.text: We own a 2014 R Pod 177. We ordered the 19 ft cover. The biggest reason I didn't give this a 5 star rating, is that the fabric is very thin and can easily be torn. The advantage to the light weight fabric is, that it makes it easier to get up and over the trailer. It takes 2 people to put on, one of which who is on a step ladder. It fits just like expected. There is a zippered area over the door, and zippers over the storage area, so you can get into the camper after you winterize it. Over all this is a good cover and we'll see how it does in a Minnesota winter.
customer_reviews.author: anonymous

customer_reviews.title: I’m trying to get the right one
customer_reviews.text: First the car is too small for the trailer RV Second the side door is in the other side
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Bought this as a generic universal fit for my teardrop ...
customer_reviews.text: Bought this as a generic universal fit for my teardrop trailer. The OEM cover goes for about $550 which made it cost prohibitive. I did have an OEM cover but it has dry rotted. The camping season is over so now I can put the camper in storage.
customer_reviews.author: 1hapiflip

customer_reviews.title: Great Fit but Terrible quality
customer_reviews.text: Bought this RV cover in April 15 2019 And now the whole top of it is starting to deteriorate I would not recommend purchasing this item I guess you get what you pay for When I first put this item on I was very pleased how it fit my our pod 180 RV But that doesn’t do me any good if it only last 2 months.
customer_reviews.author: dorothy spalten

customer_reviews.title: Covers My T@B Outback
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this for my 2018 nuCamp T@B travel trailer. It's not perfect for this type of trailer, but does the job of covering the trailer with the tire rack on back, and a Fantastic Breeze vent cover on top.I has yet to prove itself through a midwest winter.
customer_reviews.author: Bob B.

customer_reviews.title: Awesome
customer_reviews.text: This cover is just what the camper needed & it fits perfectly. Ordered wheel covers for it also. I would give this product a 10 +
customer_reviews.author: USAF

customer_reviews.title: Snug
customer_reviews.text: Mayb we got the size wrong but Its a pretty tight fit altho the trailer is covered
customer_reviews.author: calgal

product_meta.title: Classic Accessories Over Drive PolyPRO3 Deluxe R-Pod Travel Trailer Cover, Fits up to 17' 7" Long - Trailer Body Only
product_meta.description: Size:Model 4Durable PolyPRO3™ RV covers provide streamlined, strong protection that stands out from the pack. When you buy from Classic Accessories, you’ll receive peace of mind along with your product, thanks to the easiest warranty in the industry. If you’re disappointed with your purchase within the warranty period, look for us online and take advantage of our Hassle-Free warranty program supported by our US-based team.
feature_bullets: R-Pod Cover: Fits R-Pod trailers 17' 7"L - Trailer Body Only. Fits RP-179
The thick triple-ply fabric top defends your RV from rain, snow, dirt, and scratches for all-season protection. Integrated air vents reduce wind stress and inside moisture

Adjustable tension panels and elasticized hem corners provide a custom-like fit; straps secure the cover while a toss bag system makes installation quick and easy; fit dimensions include trailer and hitch but product not designed to cover hitch
Zippered panels allow access to the RV doors and engine areas; stuff sacks and tie-down straps are included on all covers

specifications.Cover Included: Arctic Blue Product 80-197 R-Pod Trlr Cover Up To 20'
specifications.Customer Reviews: 3.7 out of 5 stars477 ratings3.7 out of 5 stars
